element.name: Define Geocaching by AbbeyAckbar, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)
element.long-description:
Raheny is a bustling village with many amenities to avail from including St. Anne's park, Dublin’s second largest park. There are tennis courts & a par-three golf course in St. Anne’s. Also in Raheny is the major athletics club (Raheny Shamrocks). There are many more amenities including Raheny library which carries a range of special interest and community material, including a fine set of local history files.
On the record since 570AD. Raheny has been the name of this district for many centuries (it was noted re. 570 A.D. as Rathena). The name comes from the Irish, Rath Éanna (or Rath Eanaigh), meaning "the Fort of Éanna". This referred to an old fort in the middle of the village, which overlooked the stream known as Skillings Glas (now the Santry River). Traces of the rath have been found even in recent decades. Éanna was probably a local chieftain.
St. Assam, the patron saint of Raheny, appears in lists of saints over the centuries, with a feast day of April 27th, but detail is lacking. By 1851, the main village had 49 houses and 295 people (interestingly, a report of c. fifteen years earlier shows over 600 people, while today the district has over 20,000 people).
The above information was taken from the following website: www.raheny.com ____________________________________________________________
* There are many places to park within the village within easy reach of all the stages of the cache.
* The district is served by several bus routes including 29A, 31, 31A, 32, 32A and 32B
* Raheny Dart station is but a stone's throw away from Stage 1 of the multi-cache
There are 7 short stages to this multicache which take you on a quick roundtrip tour of the village where you'll see some places of interest & learn interesting facts about Raheny's history. It should take less than an hour.
The cache is only available at the following times:
Monday to Thursday: 10.00am - 8.00pm
Friday, Saturday: 10.00am - 5.00pm
Sunday: NOT AVAILABLE
NOTE: Although you have to adhere to the above times in order to find the cache, don't pay so much attention to them when you work out the final co-ords of this multi to locate the cache. Trust your GPSr! It will all make sense when you do. I guess this cache is half multi/half puzzle : ) See the hint for extra help.
This note has been added as cachers have been finding it difficult to locate the cache due to thinking their final co-ords were wrong as the time restrictions were offputting their search.
IMPORTANT:
FINDS THAT DO NOT HAVE
A MATCHING SIGNATURE IN THE LOG BOOK
WILL BE REMOVED
___________________________________________________________
Stage 1: The listed co-ords. bring you to the 1st stage of the cache.
What year was Manhattan Bar re-named Station House.
Add the first and last number in this year. This number = A
Stage 2: N53 22.838 W006 10.503 Note the year Samuel Dick died.
The last number in this year = B
Stage 3: N53 22.811 W006 10.604 What year was the Raheny Business Association founded.
The second number in this year = C
Stage 4: N53 22.728 W006 10.653 Note the year in which the memorial stone was erected.
Add the 4 numbers in this year. This number = D
Stage 5: N53 22.795 W006 10.492 How much did this building cost.
This number = EFG
Stage 6: N53 22.814 W006 10.479 Note the century of the chapel mentioned at these co-ordinates.
This number = H
Final Co-ordinates: N53 AB.[C-E]G[A+F] W006 [D-15].[F-E][E+F][H-C]
You can check your answer for this multi here : Geochecker.com.
Feel free to post photos from your trip around Raheny but
PLEASE don't post photos of the cache container to your log
element.additional-waypoints:
S21ER3D - Stage 2
N 53° 22.838 W 006° 10.503
Note the year Samuel Dick died. The last no. in this year = B
S31ER3D - Stage 3
N 53° 22.811 W 006° 10.604
Note the year the Raheny Business Association was founded The second number in this year = C
S41ER3D - Stage 4
N 53° 22.728 W 006° 10.653
Note the year in which the memorial stone was erected. Add the 4 numbers in this year. This number = D
S51ER3D - Stage 5
N 53° 22.795 W 006° 10.492
Note how much this building cost. This number = EFG
S61ER3D - Stage 6
N 53° 22.814 W 006° 10.479
Note the century of the chapel mentioned at these co-ordinates. This number = H
element.encoded-hints: Have a seat at the final location

ul.li:
2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
It is a great Cache and an excellent final!!! Had a lot of fun!
Thx a lot for this perfect cache and kind regards from Austria, eve

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Write note by AbbeyAckbar
The cache will not be accessible this bank holiday Monday 7th June.

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
A final location I've never seen before. TFTC, GudrunXY

2010-05-13T19:00:00Z : Write note by Crannyn
Revisited as junior crannyn wanted to try and find it.We left a TB. T again FTC.

2010-04-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by hollmanr
Found it this morning with crannyn after a lovely cycle and walk around Raheny. The previous logs and the cache availability times really got the auld grey matter confused and on the wrong track and I'm sure there are a few taxi men in raheny who where wondering why we were hanging around the cache area. What a great idea and a great cache. Had a lovely lunch in Mulino's afterwards - tasting better of course after the find. SL Took pathtag to log as haven't logged one of these before. SL TFTC

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Define Geocaching
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Raheny is a bustling village with many amenities to avail from including St. Anne's park, Dublin’s second largest park. There are tennis courts & a par-three golf course in St. Anne’s. Also in Raheny is the major athletics club (Raheny Shamrocks). There are many more amenities including Raheny library which carries a range of special interest and community material, including a fine set of local history files.

On the record since 570AD. Raheny has been the name of this district for many centuries (it was noted re. 570 A.D. as Rathena). The name comes from the Irish, Rath Éanna (or Rath Eanaigh), meaning "the Fort of Éanna". This referred to an old fort in the middle of the village, which overlooked the stream known as Skillings Glas (now the Santry River). Traces of the rath have been found even in recent decades. Éanna was probably a local chieftain.

St. Assam, the patron saint of Raheny, appears in lists of saints over the centuries, with a feast day of April 27th, but detail is lacking.

By 1851, the main village had 49 houses and 295 people (interestingly, a report of c. fifteen years earlier shows over 600 people, while today the district has over 20,000 people).

The above information was taken from the following website: www.raheny.com

____________________________________________________________

* There are many places to park within the village within easy reach of all the stages of the cache.
* The district is served by several bus routes including 29A, 31, 31A, 32, 32A and 32B
* Raheny Dart station is but a stone's throw away from Stage 1 of the multi-cache

There are 7 short stages to this multicache which take you on a quick roundtrip tour of the village where you'll see some places of interest & learn interesting facts about Raheny's history. It should take less than an hour.

The cache is only available at the following times:
Monday to Thursday: 10.00am - 8.00pm
Friday, Saturday: 10.00am - 5.00pm
Sunday: NOT AVAILABLE

NOTE: Although you have to adhere to the above times in order to find the cache, don't pay so much attention to them when you work out the final co-ords of this multi to locate the cache. Trust your GPSr! It will all make sense when you do. I guess this cache is half multi/half puzzle : ) See the hint for extra help.
This note has been added as cachers have been finding it difficult to locate the cache due to thinking their final co-ords were wrong as the time restrictions were offputting their search.

IMPORTANT:

FINDS THAT DO NOT HAVE
A MATCHING SIGNATURE IN THE LOG BOOK
WILL BE REMOVED

___________________________________________________________

Stage 1:

The listed co-ords. bring you to the 1st stage of the cache.
What year was Manhattan Bar re-named Station House.
Add the first and last number in this year. This number = A

Stage 2: N53 22.838 W006 10.503

Note the year Samuel Dick died.
The last number in this year = B

Stage 3: N53 22.811 W006 10.604

What year was the Raheny Business Association founded.
The second number in this year = C

Stage 4: N53 22.728 W006 10.653

Note the year in which the memorial stone was erected.
Add the 4 numbers in this year. This number = D

Stage 5: N53 22.795 W006 10.492

How much did this building cost.
This number = EFG

Stage 6: N53 22.814 W006 10.479

Note the century of the chapel mentioned at these co-ordinates.
This number = H

Final Co-ordinates: N53 AB.[C-E]G[A+F] W006 [D-15].[F-E][E+F][H-C]

You can check your answer for this multi here : Geochecker.com.

Feel free to post photos from your trip around Raheny but
PLEASE don't post photos of the cache container to your log

Note the year Samuel Dick died. The last no. in this year = B
